description.narrative: Output 3.4: By 2018, vulnerable populations at risk of/affected by crises, natural disasters and displacement, have improved access to safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018, children, in particular the most vulnerable, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation facilities in schools, health centers and communities to prevent diseases, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.4: By 2018, vulnerable populations at risk of/affected by crises, natural disasters and displacement, have improved access to safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation

description.narrative: In 2018, 747,433 people affected by the four humanitarian crises (population movements, floods, epidemics and nutrition crisis) gained access to safe water, hygiene and sanitation through emergency response actions. The WASH Cluster coordination and the supported to the government to setup functional WASH technical groups continued to improve. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

Existence of functioning cluster coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene in humanitarian situations
